name: Ext.fx.Animator
doc:
This class is used to run keyframe based animations, which follows the CSS3 based animation structure. Keyframe animations differ from typical from/to animations in that they offer the ability to specify values at various points throughout the animation.

Using Keyframes

The keyframes option is the most important part of specifying an animation when using this class. A key frame is a point in a particular animation. We represent this as a percentage of the total animation duration. At each key frame, we can specify the target values at that time. Note that you must specify the values at 0% and 100%, the start and ending values. There is also a keyframe event that fires after each key frame is reached.

Example

In the example below, we modify the values of the element at each fifth throughout the animation.

Ext.create('Ext.fx.Animator', {
    target: Ext.getBody().createChild({
        style: {
            width: '100px',
            height: '100px',
            'background-color': 'red'
        }
    }),
    duration: 10000, // 10 seconds
    keyframes: {
        0: {
            opacity: 1,
            backgroundColor: 'FF0000'
        },
        20: {
            x: 30,
            opacity: 0.5
        },
        40: {
            x: 130,
            backgroundColor: '0000FF'
        },
        60: {
            y: 80,
            opacity: 0.3
        },
        80: {
            width: 200,
            y: 200
        },
        100: {
            opacity: 1,
            backgroundColor: '00FF00'
        }
    }
});

members.name: delay
members.doc: Time to delay before starting the animation. Defaults to 0.
members.short_doc: Time to delay before starting the animation. ...

members.name: duration
members.doc: Time in milliseconds for the animation to last. Defaults to 250.
members.short_doc: Time in milliseconds for the animation to last. ...

members.name: dynamic
members.doc: Currently only for Component Animation: Only set a component's outer element size bypassing layouts. Set to true to do full layouts for every frame of the animation. Defaults to false.
members.short_doc: Currently only for Component Animation: Only set a component's outer element size bypassing layouts. ...

members.name: easing
members.doc:
This describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated. It allows for a transition to change speed over its duration.

  • backIn
  • backOut
  • bounceIn
  • bounceOut
  • ease
  • easeIn
  • easeOut
  • easeInOut
  • elasticIn
  • elasticOut
  • cubic-bezier(x1, y1, x2, y2)

Note that cubic-bezier will create a custom easing curve following the CSS3 transition-timing-function specification. The four values specify points P1 and P2 of the curve as (x1, y1, x2, y2). All values must be in the range [0, 1] or the definition is invalid.
members.short_doc: This describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated. ...

members.name: iterations
members.doc: Number of times to execute the animation. Defaults to 1.
members.short_doc: Number of times to execute the animation. ...

members.name: keyframes
members.doc:
Animation keyframes follow the CSS3 Animation configuration pattern. 'from' is always considered '0%' and 'to' is considered '100%'.Every keyframe declaration must have a keyframe rule for 0% and 100%, possibly defined using "from" or "to". A keyframe declaration without these keyframe selectors is invalid and will not be available for animation. The keyframe declaration for a keyframe rule consists of properties and values. Properties that are unable to be animated are ignored in these rules, with the exception of 'easing' which can be changed at each keyframe. For example:

keyframes : {
    '0%': {
        left: 100
    },
    '40%': {
        left: 150
    },
    '60%': {
        left: 75
    },
    '100%': {
        left: 100
    }
}
members.short_doc: Animation keyframes follow the CSS3 Animation configuration pattern. ...

members.name: target
members.doc: The Ext.fx.target to apply the animation to. If not specified during initialization, this can be passed to the applyAnimator method to apply the same animation to many targets.
members.short_doc: The Ext.fx.target to apply the animation to. ...

members.name: animKeyFramesRE
applyAnimator
members.doc: Applies animation to the Ext.fx.target
members.short_doc: Applies animation to the Ext.fx.target ...

members.name: currentIteration
members.doc: Current iteration the animation is running.
members.short_doc: Current iteration the animation is running. ...

members.name: damper
delayStart
members.doc: private used to track a delayed starting time
members.short_doc: private used to track a delayed starting time ...

members.name: isAnimator
members.doc: true in this class to identify an object as an instantiated Animator, or subclass thereof.
members.short_doc: true in this class to identify an object as an instantiated Animator, or subclass thereof. ...

members.name: keyframeStep
members.doc: Current keyframe step of the animation.
members.short_doc: Current keyframe step of the animation. ...

members.name: paused
members.doc: Flag to determine if the animation is paused. Only set this to true if you need to keep the Anim instance around to be unpaused later; otherwise call end.
members.short_doc: Flag to determine if the animation is paused. ...

members.name: running
members.doc: Flag to determine if the animation has started
members.short_doc: Flag to determine if the animation has started ...

members.name: createTimeline
members.doc: Takes the given keyframe configuration object and converts it into an ordered array with the passed attributes per keyframe or applying the 'to' configuration to all keyframes. Also calculates the proper animation duration per keyframe.
members.short_doc: Takes the given keyframe configuration object and converts it into an ordered array with the passed attributes per ke...

members.name: end
members.doc: Fire afteranimate event and end the animation. Usually called automatically when the animation reaches its final frame, but can also be called manually to pre-emptively stop and destroy the running animation.
members.short_doc: Fire afteranimate event and end the animation. ...

members.name: isReady
isRunning
lastFrame
members.doc: Perform lastFrame cleanup and handle iterations
members.short_doc: Perform lastFrame cleanup and handle iterations ...

members.name: sorter
start
members.doc: Fires beforeanimate and sets the running flag.
members.short_doc: Fires beforeanimate and sets the running flag. ...

members.name: afteranimate
members.doc: Fires when the animation is complete.
members.short_doc: Fires when the animation is complete. ...

members.name: beforeanimate
members.doc: Fires before the animation starts. A handler can return false to cancel the animation.
members.short_doc: Fires before the animation starts. ...

members.name: keyframe
members.doc: Fires at each keyframe.
members.short_doc: Fires at each keyframe. ...

short_doc: This class is used to run keyframe based animations, which follows the CSS3 based animation structure. ...
